full_summary:
**Tender Announcement**
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada is soliciting bids for a custom combining service at the Brandon Research and Development Centre. The contract will cover the harvesting of various crops, including barley, wheat, peas, soybeans, corn, and canola, over an approximate area of 1,500 acres.

**Bid Requirements**

Bids should include the supply of labor, materials, fuel, equipment, and supervision necessary to fulfill the contract requirements. Additionally, accurate and mapped yield and moisture information must be provided. The successful bidder will be responsible for fulfilling the contract period, which runs from August 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024, with an option to extend for up to three additional one-year periods.

**Evaluation Criteria**

Bids will be assessed based on the fulfillment of the mandatory technical requirements and the financial evaluation. A bid must meet all the technical requirements to be considered responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award.

**Submission Details**

Submissions will be accepted via email only. Bidders should submit their proposals to melissa.smith3@agr.gc.ca and aafc.wscprocurement-csoapprovisionnement.aac@agr.gc.ca. For further information, please refer to the attached solicitation documents.

**Trade Agreements**

This solicitation is governed by the following international trade agreements:

* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)

**Language of Bid**

Bids may be submitted in either English or French.

**Excluded Regions**

The contract does not specify any excluded regions. However, all fields are within a 25-kilometer radius of the Brandon Research and Development Centre.

**Indigenous Procurement**

The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for government and private sector organizations to identify Indigenous business capacity. Although this solicitation does not require Indigenous participation, having a business profile in the IBD may provide additional business opportunities.

**Notice URL and Document**

Notice URL and attached document can be found athttps://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/4237/rfp-01r11-24-c012---%28e.pdf (English).
